div1.p: Hench requests copies of pamphlets and slides to use in the dedication of the Lazear Memorial.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Department of Public Education, American Museum of Natural History, August 26, 1940
div1.opener:
August 26, 1940
Department of Public Education
American Museum of Natural History
77th Street and Central Park West
New York City
Gentlemen:
div1.p:
I am anxious to obtain a copy of the pamphlet “Conquest of
Yellow Fever” written by Dr. James E. Peabody, some years ago. There is no date
on the pamphlet. On page 33 of this pamphlet, it mentions a list of 70
lantern slides available for school use. I would appreciate it greatly to be
permitted to see these slides. I am also anxious to obtain a copy of an article
written by Dr. Peabody, entitled, “The Republic Remembers”, reprinted from Medical
Progress, March, 1928. If Dr. Peabody is living in New York, I will appreciate
it greatly if you would transmit this letter to him if you, yourself, are unable
to send me these articles.

My reason for asking for this help is as follows. I have been
asked to give an address on the conquest of yellow fever on the occasion of the dedica-
tion of the Lazear Memorial Building at Washington and Jefferson College on October 26.
In this connection, I have visited several of the survivors of the yellow fever experi-
ments, including Messrs. Kissinger and Moran, the latter of Havana, and also General
Kean of Washington. There is some material in Dr. Peabody's pamphlets which I have not
seen elsewhere, and one of the pamphlets mentions a more complete bibliography available
on request (page 33). Whatever help you can give me will be greatly appreciated, and
I shall be glad to pay the express or postal charges connected with sending the lantern
slides here. I should like to see them now, and if some of them are especially suitable,
I should like to use them on the occasion of my address, or, with your permission, have
copies made of them here.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
